name: day retreat - Animal flow & brunch
description: Come join us for a day filled with fun , relaxation and good food. It’s an all day retreat which entails a combination of activities and food breaks. The whole event is tailored keeping in mind , nourishment for the body and mind so take a break and indulge in some mindful activities. The day should look like 930 am - Arrival Upon arrival indulge in some healthy nourishing breakfast.10am  Warm up with some fun game and activities 11am - 12pm Functional training to prepare for the events to follow and end with a session of tug of war12pm to 1 pm Indulge in some lip smacking food laid out as a communal lunch by Master chef Arthi , whose has a speciality pop up restaurant Ragù1pm - 2pm You have some free time , use this time for conversations , a stroll in the farm or read a book 2pm - 4pm We will have a session of animal flow taught by Ranjit from ,Academy of strength , followed by mobility and flexibility session.4pm to 5pm Indulge in snacks and some fun games to end the session

name: Kids Playdate At the yard | In collaboration with The LooRoo Club
description: Monthly Kids Playdate is here! 🌟We’ve got two fun-filled slots for different age groups:10:30 AM - 12:00 PM: A Celebration of RakhiAge Group: 2 to 6 yearsWhether you come as brother and sister, sisters, brothers or friends, this is the perfect opportunity to celebrate your special bond together. We’ll kick off the day with an engaging and interactive reading of Kahaani Chamkeeli, where your little ones will discover the origins of Raksha Bandhan. The fun continues with a day filled with Rakhi-making, diya decorating, and nature play, along with sensory activities—all in signature LooRoo style!3:00 PM - 4:30 PM: The LooRoo Tea Party!Age Group: 4 to 8 yearsJoin us for the LooRoo Tea Party—a perfect blend of tiger mischief, mini cooking adventures, and lots of artsy fun to celebrate this amazing book! We'll have magical tea blends, exciting storytelling, tiger-striped art, and tales about the tigers of our jungle. Come spend a lovely monsoon evening with us at the Courtyard! :)Choose your adventure and join us for a wonderful day of exploration and fun! Terms and ConditionsThe management bears no responsibility for any injury or damage incurred during the event.Purchase tickets exclusively from the designated ticketing platform.No refunds for no-shows or cancellations under any circumstances.Tickets are non-transferable and intended for personal use only.Event schedule and menu subject to change in case of emergencies or events beyond our control.The management will not entertain liability claims arising from the consumption of food or beverages.Parking near the event venue is at the vehicle owner's risk. Paid valet parking available at Rs. 200 per car.Ticket holders grant organizers perpetual rights to use any recorded video or still footage of their appearance on any channel, without further approval.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: hatha yoga and flow session
description: This day retreat provides a unique experience that combines the benefits of Hatha yoga, flow sessions, and plant-based meals in a picturesque natural setting. Hatha yoga, a practice that encourages well-being through the combination of laughter and deep breathing, helps release tension and promotes a positive mindset. Flow sessions, which blend movement and mindfulness techniques, aim to cultivate inner peace and harmony. The just be cafe , by nidhi nahata offers a variety of nourishing meals designed to satisfy both the body and the soul, ensuring that participants feel revitalized and rejuvenated. Immerse yourself in nature and take this opportunity to reconnect with your mind, body, and spirit. Whether you are looking to relax, recharge, or simply enjoy the beauty of the surroundings, this retreat offers a holistic approach to wellness that will leave you feeling refreshed and inspired.

name: The Courtyard Baithak- An Evening of Hindustani Classical Music
description: This will be Courtyard Baithak's first classical recital. The Baithak will feature Khayal, Thumri, and Abhang by Siddhartha Belmannu.The Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the Artist - Siddhartha BelmannuSiddhartha Belmannu is acclaimed as a musical prodigy and a trailblazer in Indian classical music. Hailing from Karkala, a quaint town in the Udupi district of Karnataka, Siddhartha’s remarkable vocal talent was evident from an early age. His musical journey began with Carnatic Classical Music, but it was under the esteemed guidance of Sri P.R. Manjunath that he delved into Hindustani Classical Music. His path took a transformative turn with the mentorship of Pandit Vinayak Torvi, a revered maestro of the Gwalior and Kirana gharanas. This extensive training, spanning 13 years in the Gurukul system, allowed Siddhartha to refine his skills and create a distinct style that harmoniously blends tradition with contemporary innovation. His exceptional achievements earned him a special mention in Forbes’ '30 under 30' list for 2021 in the music category.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Fireback, Goa at The Conservatory
description: About the MealFireback's a la carte menu is a tribute to Thailand's rich culinary heritage, showcasing the depth and diversity of its flavors. This thoughtfully curated selection is the creation of Chef Kaustubh Haldipur, who will be presenting it at The Conservatory.Meet Chef Kaustubh Haldipur at The ConservatoryWith over 15 years of experience in Asian cuisine, Chef Kaustubh brings a wealth of expertise to the table. His career spans across esteemed establishments like 'Wasabi by Morimoto' and 'Yauatcha Bengaluru,' and he has led culinary teams at prestigious venues across India and internationally. At Fireback, Chef Kaustubh blends traditional Thai flavors with modern techniques, ensuring each dish is an authentic yet innovative culinary experience.About FirebackFireback, the newest addition to the EHV portfolio, is an exciting Thai restaurant and bar with legendary Chef David Thompson as Culinary Director. Hidden behind an old Portuguese bungalow, it serves authentic Thai food at a picturesque riverside setting in Siolim, Goa. The name is inspired by the Thai national bird, the Siamese Fireback, and reflects the fire-grilled cooking behind many of the dishes. The restaurant, a modern glass house, steps down onto outdoor decks and a promenade overlooking the river. Guests can dine by a fish pond or at riverside tables, with an outdoor bar taking center stage. The stunning St. Anthony’s Church in the distance enhances this unique setting. FIREBACK (A la carte menu)SOUPFresh Coconut Cream, Galangal, Charred Chilies (INR 435)Tofu & king mushroom/ Chicken/ PrawnSMALL PLATESPineapple Som Tam (V) (INR 475)Tamarind, toasted coconut, roasted peanuts, thai bird chilliesKaffir Corn Fritters (V) (INR 490)Served with ajad salad, fresh sambalFireback Fried Chicken (NV) (INR 675)Cumin, shallots Grilled King Fish Salad (NV) (INR 775)Citrus tomato dressing, raw mango Fried Pork Belly (NV) (INR 995)Charred cabbage, tamarind dipRiver Prawns Three Flavored (NV) (INR 1095)Nam prik chilly paste, fried basilGRILLED  Pumpkin & Sweet Potato (V) (INR 665)Toasted coconut, red chillies Lamb Chop Gorlae (NV) (INR 1195)Toasted coconut, red chilliesLARGE PLATESThai Stir-fried Vegetables (V) (INR 725)lotus root, long beans, pok choy, corn, yellow bean, nam prik chiliKhmoy Green Curry Pea Eggplant, Heart of Palm Vegetarian-INR 745 / Chicken–INR 855 / Red Snapper- INR 1055Aromatic Curry (V) (INR 745)Plantain, pumpkin, deep fried shallots, cucumber relishMassaman Curry Lamb (NV) (INR 1125)Grounded spice, onion, pumpkin, potatoes, peanutSIDES  Steamed Jasmine Rice (INR 295) Fried Rice (V) (INR 575)Sun-dried tomatoes, cashew, spring onionJumbo Lump Crab Fried Rice (NV) (INR 995)Served with cucumber, lemon, corianderDESSERTS Pandanus Noodles (V) (INR 695)Perfumed mix fruits, syrup & iceCashew Nut Pudding (NV) (INR 695)Caramelized taro, fresh coconut creamTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen."Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Functional Mushroom Yoga + Brunch
description: We are exciting to bring to you a one of a kind experience at the Studio by Copper + Cloves - Nuvedo X Copper + Cloves which is all about exploring and experiencing the amazing healing power of mushrooms!The morning will start with an explanation about the properties of functional mushrooms and how they are harvested. At the start of the yoga class, led by the wonderful Julia, you will receive a functional mushroom extract dose, cordyceps, which will boost your stamina and endurance: by increasing your VO2 max levels, enhancing your body's ability to utilise oxygen during the class. At a natural pause during the class, you will receive a dose of lion's mane extract, to uplift your mood with its adaptogenic properties, supporting you feel more at ease in the latter, slower part of the class and get the most out of the seated asanas. The 75 minute practice will be followed by a sharing feast at the Studio by the Copper + Cloves Chef team. We will incorporate functional mushrooms into the brunch, from pan-fried lion's mane on sourdough, to a reishi-cacao balls. Why we are so excited about this unique event:By receiving these extracts during a yoga class centred on synchronising breath and movement you will get the most out of these amazing mushroomsYou will leave this practice feeling more grounded and embodied.During the sharing-feast we'll all eat together so it's a wonderful chance to meet like-minded people.You'll get the chance to try delicious food including functional mushrooms, so you will also receive the nutritional benefits of these fungi. You will learn more about mushrooms and how they can support your journey to health. The team of experts from Nuvedo will help you understand why the extracts are unique and deep dive into the wonderful world of mushrooms.This will be a truly special experience - if you have ever been curious about functional mushrooms and how they could support your health journey, this is the event for you!

name: The Picnic Table by Geist Brewing Co. OMR
description: Indulge in classic dishes that will have you reminiscing about simpler times. We've got a spread of nostalgic favourites alongside refreshing beers and mocktails – something to please all palates! But this isn't just a trip down memory lane. It's a chance to create new memories with loved ones in the vibrant green space of our restaurant. Join us for a day of delicious food, good company, and a touch of sweet nostalgia!Food MenuBread ServiceHerb & Sundried Tomato FocacciaRustic Mini BaguetteSpreads & DipsThe Trio Jar: Marinated Labneh, Coriander & Peanut Pesto, Tomato ChundoHummus with Chilli Crunch & ZaatarChicken Liver PâtéSaladBarley, Bean & Beetroot Salad: Barley, roasted beetroot, curry ranch dressing, cucumber, cherry tomato, pomegranate, Granny Smith apple, orange segments, creamy labneh, lettuce & herbs, pumpkin seedsBurgers & SandwichesCaprese Panini: Tomato chundo, oven-roasted tomato, bocconcini, coriander pesto, arugula, herbed paniniJerk Chicken Panini: Grilled jerk chicken, garlic coriander mayo, pineapple slaw, ciabattaDessertsChocolate Ganache CakeBeverage Menu Mocktail or Coolers: Tiki Taka or canned beveragesCrowlers: Witty Wit, Weiss Guy, and Repeat (6 cans)Terms and Conditions -1) Inclusions: Each ticket includes a picnic basket that serves 3-4 people, containing food and either mocktails or 6 crowlers of beer, depending on the ticket type purchased.2)Refunds and Cancellations: All ticket sales are final. No refunds or cancellations will be entertained.3)Alcohol Consumption: Attendees must be 21 years of age or older to consume alcoholic beverages. Valid ID proof will be required at the event.4)Weather Policy: The event will proceed rain or shine. In the case of severe weather, Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to cancel the event. Ticket holders will be notified, and a refund or rescheduled date will be provided.5)Photography and Media: By attending the event, attendees consent to being photographed or filmed. Geist Brewing Co. reserves the right to use these images for promotional purposes.6)Food Allergies: Attendees with food allergies or dietary restrictions should inform the event organisers in advance.By purchasing a ticket, you agree to abide by these terms and conditions. We look forward to welcoming you to The Picnic Table by Geist for a memorable day of food and fun.

description: Come join us this Full Moon, for a yin yoga + sound bath experience.Deepika an experienced sound bath practitioner aims in blending creative expression and sound healing to manifest desires. name: Garden Wine & Cheese Tasting Party
description: Bangalore! You asked for it, and we’re delivering—get ready for a super fun and unwind-worthy wine & cheese tasting in the perfect garden setting!Join us for our next wine-tasting experience - an epic garden party where you’ll explore 12 deliciously refreshing wines from Garden By Su’s new menu with Somm Devati Mallick. It’s a casual, walk-around tasting format so you can sip and mingle at your own pace.And let’s not forget the pièce de résistance—an epic cheese grazing station, brought to you by award-winning artisan cheese brand Käse from Chennai. Chat all things wine and cheese with Devati (Drink with D) and Namrata (Käse), discover new favourite sips and new friends, and soak in those gorgeous garden vibes.Whether you come with friends or roll solo, this will be a blast! Don’t miss out on this awesome new wine-tasting spot in the city. See you there?

name: Writer's Circle
description: Led by Abraham Koshy is a PhD in political communication and the Editor of a new Bangalore-focused publication launching this year. Abe is excited to introduce the Writer's Circle to support those budding journalists and writers who dream of publishing their stories in print.The Writer’s Circle is all about giving Bangaloreans the space and the tools to produce non-fiction stories about the city and/or their experience in it. You will be supported in a collaborative environment to workshop ideas, explore narratives and refine structure, with the goal of publishing in a brand new Bangalore-centric print magazine that’s going to start publishing later this year.  The kinds of stories we’re interested in telling:1. Expats/Former Expats/Migrants to Blr and their experience of/in the city 2. Narratives/Histories of city objects (broadly defined)3. Sustainable living in the city 4. Revelations from therapy and other aspects of mental health in the city 5. Dating and relationships 6. Hobby Drama7. Buying Drama 8. Any other apolitical stories that this list inspiresThe Studio by Copper + Cloves is a beautiful space for this experience. We will serve light healthy snacks to fuel you through the session. Please bring along your fav writing device - a laptop or a tablet or a notebook, whichever you are comfortable with.

description: We are exciting to bring to you a one of a kind experience at the Studio by Copper + Cloves in collaboration with Gunam Beauty. The face rejuvenation session led by Julia will begin with a short, full body warm up and breathing practice to wake up the entire lymphatic system to aid with flushing out the toxins from our skin. This will be followed by a gentle but effective face massage with Gunam’s powerful Multi-correctional face oil. While the oil works it’s magic on our skin we will practice some face yoga to wake up and strengthen the facial muscles.The Multi-correctional Face Oil is a blend of 14 different plant oils, clinically proven to reduce signs of sun damage, pigmentation, scars, and fine lines.Following the face yoga session we will be nourishing you with a skin-healthy, nourishing brunch focusing on hydrating ingredients. We look forward to sharing this lovely practice with you! 🥰

name: Chocolate Profiling Workshop with Manam Chocolate: Unlocking the Endless Possibilities of Cacao
description: About the Workshop at The ConservatoryThis session starts with a brief on the history of Cacao, starting from its Mesoamerican origin and culminating in the present-day transformation into the world of craft chocolate. It traverses through 3 centuries and multiple geo-political events and how they affected the story of Cacao and chocolate and tries to speak about what the future might hold for chocolate and how we at Manam Chocolate see ourselves fit into that narrative. This discussion will be followed by a profiling session that forms an introduction to appreciating craft chocolate. It includes an introduction to aroma training, and taste training and takes the audience through tasting various samples of craft chocolate and defects (Industrial Chocolate). Workshop by CHAITANYA MUPPALA,FOUNDER & CEO, MANAM CHOCOLATE & DISTINCT ORIGINS PRIVATE LIMITED Chaitanya Muppala is the CEO of Distinct Origins Private Limited, which launched Manam Chocolate, an Indian Craft Chocolate brand. A second-generation entrepreneur with over 10 years of experience in the Indian food industry, Chaitanya holds a degree from Sauder School of Business, UBC, and has completed the Stanford Seed Program. In 2021, he founded Distinct Origins to develop India’s fine-flavor cacao industry, establishing the country’s largest cacao fermentary in West Godavari. He also built Manam Chocolate, which launched in August 2023. Before this, Chaitanya led Almond House, a renowned premium sweets brand, expanding its reach across South India.Workshop AgendaIntroduction to Cacao's Origin and History ● Mesoamerican origins of cacao ● Role of cacao in ancient civilizations (Mayans, Aztecs) ● Cacao as a sacred beverage and currency Cacao in the Age of Exploration ● Arrival of cacao in Europe ● Transformation of cacao into a chocolate drink ● Spread of chocolate culture in Europe Industrial Revolution and Mass Production ● Development of chocolate manufacturing processes ● Mass production and availability of chocolate ● Emergence of famous chocolate brands Geo-Political Events and Chocolate ● Impact of World Wars on chocolate production and consumption ● Post-war chocolate boom Craft Chocolate Renaissance ● Rise of craft chocolate makers ● Focus on quality, ethics, and sustainability ● Artisanal production methods and single-origin chocolates Future ● Changing consumer preferences (health-conscious, ethical sourcing) ● Sustainability challenges in cacao farming ● Innovation in chocolate production (flavors, techniques) Manam Chocolates Role in the Narrative ● Our commitment to quality craft chocolate ● Contribution to preserving cacao's heritage and elevating the chocolate experienceIntroduction to Craft Chocolate Appreciation ● Aroma Training:● Importance of aroma in chocolate tasting Trends in Chocolate ● Identifying different aroma profiles (fruity, nutty, floral) ● Taste Training: ● Understanding taste elements (sweetness, acidity, bitterness) ● Recognizing flavour complexities in craft chocolate Chocolate Tasting Session ● Sampling various craft chocolate bars: - Single-origin chocolate - Different flavor profiles (dark, milk, white) - Note-taking and sharing tasting experiences Defect Identification ● Introduction to common defects found in industrial chocolate Conclusion and Q&A Recap of key points in the journey of cacao and chocolate Open floor for questions and discussions about craft chocolate, its appreciation, and the future of the industry. Terms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen."Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.
